direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pikul and Geller are back at their table in the Chinese restaurant. The waiter is approaching their table. He proudly sets down a series of dishes on the lazy Susan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Special order for the birthday girl. Hope you enjoy it very much. In the dishes are a variety of cooked reptiles, amphibians, fish and birds, all weirdly mutated and presented in a bizarrely beautiful fashion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I've lost my appetite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A shame. Mutant creatures provide new and previously unimagined taste sensations. (SIGNIFICANTLY) Shall I clear all this away? Geller sees that this is a crucial game moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it looks terrific. Thank you. We're happy. The waiter nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very good. Enjoy. The waiter leaves. Geller watches him go, suspicious. When she turns back to Pikul, she is shocked to see that he has served out most of the creatures to himself and is avidly stripping the meat off their bones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pikul, what are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I find this disgusting but I can't help myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, good! Pikul looks up from his big bowl, which is rapidly filling with creature parts. His fingers are'slimy and sticky, but he doesn't stop, his fingers working expertly on their own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good? You think this is good? ( AM- O:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. It's a genuine game urge. It's something that your game character was born to do. Don't fight it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am fighting it, but it isn't doing me any good. Pikul is now snapping together bits and pieces of bone, gristle and flesh, a grotesque Lego set. When he's finished, he's made a gun very much like the one that was used in the attempted assassination in the church.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Omigod, this looks awfully familiar. You sure this is OK?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It should be OK. Now Pikul reaches into his mouth, pulls out a bridge of three teeth - one of them gold-filled - and loads them into the gristly magazine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have that bridge in real life?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely not. My teeth are perfect. Don't ask me how I knew this thing was in my mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It probably wasn't until you ordered the special. He slaps the magazine into the handle, then pulls the slide back and releases it so that there is now a toothy round in the chamber. Then with a smile, Pikul points the weapon at Geller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Death to the demoness Allegra Geller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (suddenly very uncertain) That's not funny! Pikul looks at Geller and sees that there is genuine terror in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, I couldn't resist. But you know... I do feel the urge to kill someone here. Geller grips the edge of her bowl of hot-and-sour soup - the handiest weapon she has.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to kill our waiter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, well, that makes sense. (CALLS OUT) Waiter! Waiter! (TO PIKUL) When he comes over, do it. Don't hesitate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But everything in this game is so realistic. I don't think I really could...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't be able to stop. You might as well enjoy it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Free will" is obviously not a big factor in this little world of ours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's like real life - there's just enough to make it interesting. - Pikul spots the waiter making his way across the room towards them, a big smile on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's too nice. I won't do it. The waiter arrives at their table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can I do to make your lunch more pleasant? Pikul lifts the gun and points it at the waiter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I found this in my soup and I'm very upset. Pikul fires. The tooth-bullet hits the waiter in the cheekbone. A chunk of the waiter's cheekbone comes off and his head jerks back like a fighter taking a stiff jab. The waiter's sweet face instantly transforms into a hideous, angry, snarling mask of hatred. He pulls a meat cleaver out of his jacket. Geller immediately throws her bowl of hot-and-sour soup into the waiter's face. The waiter screams, then wildly wipes the noodles and goop out of his eyes. He raises the cleaver over his head. The waiter swings and lunges across the table, managing only to hack the tip of the gun off. Pikul is shocked to see the gun begin to bleed. The waiter, sprawling across the table, screams as he tries to reach Geller with his cleaver. Pikul
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . fires into the waiter's shrieking, open mouth - a tooth- bullet into teeth. A piece of the waiter's skull comes off like a piece of coconut, the gold-filled tooth now flattened and embedded in it. The gun is bleeding all over Pikul's hand now. He drops it in disgust. The restaurant dog comes out of nowhere, picks the gun up, and runs off with it under a table, where he crouches down and starts to gnaw on it, growling. Pikul stands up shakily, begins to become aware of the strange, tense stillness of the other patrons in the restaurant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (loudly, to room) St's all right, just a little misunderstanding over the check. Pay no attention and enjoy your meal. To his surprise, the patrons actually turn back to their meals, albeit with a certain sinister reluctance. Pikul looks around wildly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel a serious game urge to get out of here! Through the porthole in one of the pair of metal-clad kitchen doors, Geller spots someone wearing a che'f's hat, someone who is wildly beckoning to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through the kitchen! That way!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHINESE RESTAURANT - DAY Geller and Pikul enter the kitchen and take a look around. There are mutant amphibians and reptiles hung up everywhere, in bowls and on chopping blocks. The kitchen workers have all turned to look at the intruders. Suddenly, a cook steps forward from around the door. We can now see that it is Nourish in a chef's outfit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you like the meal I prepared for you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. It was very... revealing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It certainly was for me. You both passed our little test with flying colours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did the Chinese waiter have to die?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A waiter hears many things spoken when people are relaxed and eating. A waiter has many opportunities for betrayal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He betrayed you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He betrayed us. Out this way, quickly! They go out a side door, and find themselves walking along the river that links the Chinese restaurant and the Trout Farm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The trio walk along the bank of the river that feeds the Trout Farm. Nourish points out a connected series of rock- lined, internally-lighted pools, some stagnant, like ponds, and some clear, with river water running through them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See there, the breeding pools. The pools are all alive with strange creatures, mutated fish, amphibians, and, along the small, muddy terraces that border the pools, reptiles. Like the dysfunctional insect at the gas station, these creatures do not work very well. They float and swim belly up, lie on their sides at the bottom of their pools, flop and flounder around, and in general, ostentatiously fail to function.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that where you caught today's special?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The restaurant is controlled by us. We raise these mutant creatures as food and that is our cover, but of course, we are also raising them as components for undetectable and hypoallergenic weapons. Right under the noses of our enemies. And speaking of our enemies, it's important that you go back to work at Cortical Systematics. We need to maintain as many agents there as we can. I'll take care of the mess at the restaurant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Trout Farm is owned by Cortical Systematics?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their corporate slogan should be, "Enemies of Reality". A glazed look comes over Pikul. He begins to speak like a robotic orator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reality is a fragile thing. Most people think that reality must of course be the most solid thing, but it isn't. Reality is threatened now more than ever. It is being eroded and it is washing away in the deforming storm of non-reality, which masquerades as reality, and eventually replaces it. Deformed and crippled and limping and hideous, threatening to engulf us all. Geller looks at Pikul in admiring disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where did that come from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The game made me do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm impressed. Nourish is also impressed. He smiles broadly, then takes Pikul in his arms and hugs him, then Geller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We love you two now, now that you have proven to be true and trustworthy Realists. We'll be in touch. Nourish turns around and walks back-towards the restaurant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Enemies of Reality"? Or does it really mean, enemies of eXistenZ? Are the Realists the game-life version of the Anti- eXistenZialists, desperately want to kill you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't take it too seriously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course you wouldn't. But maybe you should. (PAUSE) But why is the name Cortical Systematics familiar?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We saw it everywhere in Dorsey Nader's game store, remember?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. So that makes it the game- life version of our own company. Cortical Systematics is equivalent to Antenna Research in the real world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's probably fair to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, then, do we meekly go back to work and say nothing? It sounds as though Nourish and his Realists are preparing to sabotage the Trout Farm. Before you know it, they'll be planning to assassinate game designers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're just characters in here. Don't mix your real-life loyalties into it or you'll lose for sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then what do we do next?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are close on a Cortical Systematics logo on a game-pak. As Pikul and Geller pretend to examine the merchandise, they scan the game store for Nader. The store is quite crowded - same style of customers, maybe even some of the same faces, different clothes. They don't see Nader. Geller goes up to the cashier, the same gangly, sallow, bespectacled young man who was there the first time. O;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm looking for Dorsey Nader. Is he here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say that again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is Dorsey Nader here? The cashier glances around the store, then locks the register.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come with me. He's in the back. The cashier leads them through the store towards the stockroom door. As they move amongst the customers, both Pikul and Geller feel that they are being scutinized carefully by shoppers who turn their eyes away from them at the last moment, so that they can't be absolutely certain. And as for us - have we glimpsed some characters from the game that we have already seen? Possibly even Wittold Levi from the first scene in the church, and Frances the limo driver, and Gas? We aren't positive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GAME STORE - NIGHT The cashier closes the door behind them, then gestures towards the back of the stockroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want him, there he is. Nader lies dead, the unnatural purple of his face eerily matched by the veiny purple streaks in the UmbyCord around his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Migod!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened? In response, the cashier starts rummaging around on one of the shelves. He soon finds what he was looking for, and turns around to face them. In his hand is a grotesque, slightly chewed gristle gun - the one Pikul assembled in the Chinese restaurant - in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shouldn't have killed the Chinese waiter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was your contact at the Trout Farm. A damn good man. (pause; he waggles the gun) His dog brought me this. The cashier toys with the gun's claw-like hammer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we were contacted there by Yevgeny Nourish. He seemed to know exactly who we were.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's because Nader tipped him off that you were coming. Nader was a mole for Cortical Systematics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're with the Realist underground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. I was placed here to keep an eye on Nader. The cashier puts the gun back on the shelf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If Nourish isn't our real contact, who is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nourish is a double agent for Cortical Systematics. He was working with Nader to subvert the Realist cause, and doing it rather well. (SNORTS CONTEMPTUOUSLY) After all, he got you to assassinate your own contact. But now you're going to put a stop to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I assume that you both have had spinal port inserts, bioports, installed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you both realize that neither of you can be buried on hallowed ground because of these... these mutilations? Does your bioport manual tell you that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you trying to talk us into having them removed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no. In fact, you would be useless to us without them. We Realists are forbidden to have them, and so we have to use people like you on occasion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand. Are you wanting us to jack a game into our bioports?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Game? No. Not a game. A weapon. (a creepy smile) You go back to the Trout Farm, and in a familiar place, you find a mouldy old wicker basket with a thread-bare canvas cover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How will we know what to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (an even creepier' smile) Even a child would know what to do. Someone begins to knock loudly on a door very near by. The cashier is oblivious, but'both Pikul and Geller hear it. The stockroom begins to morph away as its objects are replaced one at a time by chalet objects.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone is knocking at the chalet door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (0. S. ) Sorry to interrupt you kids, but I thought you'd better have something to eat. We knocked on your door a few times to invite you to dinner... Pikul and Geller sit on the bed, game-pod between them, UmbyCord joining them to each other and to the pod. They look at each other. Pikul shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on in. The door opens slowly to reveal Vinokur, who stands there uncertainly, holding a large tray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ..and when we got no answer, I figured you were playing eXistenZ to try out your new pod, and your new bioport. Everything's all right, I take it? An awkward moment, as though Vinokur has caught the pair having illicit sex. Vinokur moves into the room towards the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I leave this here for you? Don't bother unporting. I just had to be sure our star designer was in a good place and that she'd recovered her multi- million-dollar game system from her defective pod. Vinokur puts down the tray, which holds several plates covered by smaller, inverted plates to keep the food warm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks so much, Kiri. This is very sweet of you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I take it she has.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Recovered. eXistenZ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yes, sure. That's why we're so spaced out. (TO PIKUL) We were right into it, weren't we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, we were. And it's amazing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that's a relief. I'll leave you two alone. You can leave the tray outside your door when you're finished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is that you've brought?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe it or not, it's Chinese food. There's a great Chinese restaurant on the other side of the escarpment road. Vinokur turns to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kiri?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you heard anything yet? I mean, about the eXistenZ test seminar and the shooting?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yes. It's come over all the media now. You've never been more famous. Your face is everywhere, which of course just.makes it worse. I... (a disturbed pause)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Tell me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've announced the possibility that Antenna will delay the release of your new system indefinitely, until they can determine how widespread support for this fanatical group really is. I don't approve, myself. I don't think we should bend one degree to extremists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Support for the fanatics? What does that mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you know. They're all coming out of the woodwork now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (heavy, defeated sigh) A lot of people are taking the opportunity to jump on the anti- game bandwagon. They've now heard rumours about what the eXistenZ system is, and they say we've gone too far psychologically, medically, socially, you name it. And I'm afraid I wouldn't put it past our competitors to be involved in this, to try to whip up public opinion and kill our new system before it gets born. (PAUSE) You're sure you don't want me to contact Antenna, even just to see what they have to say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not yet, Kiri. Thanks. Vinokur smiles gently and leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gesturing towards the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your friend Vinokur is getting shaky. I think he's going to turn, you in to Antenna.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds like you might approve of that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It might be the safest thing. Are you hungry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you kidding?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me neither. I'm terrified to look under the plates. (PAUSE) This "support for the fanatics" thing doesn't sound too good. Maybe we should stop...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't stop. I've been noticing some new... glitches. I'm not sure what they mean. I'm not sure the game is OK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, to be honest, I find your game very confusing. I'm not sure I want to go back in there, because I'm not convinced I'm going to keep coming out. Do you really like that feeling?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I love it. (DELICIOUSLY MUSING) When eXistenZ is released, it's gonna wipe the competition off the face of the earth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It really will do that, yes. (HEAVY PAUSE) Don't hurt me, Pikul. Don't make me go back in alone. Play with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Allegra, I'm worried that your game will wipe me off the face of the earth. I'm thinking I was right never to have a bioport installed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sly, quick smile) But you have one now. And you're ported in. She mischievously flicks the pod nipple, and the chalet melts away around them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trout-farm workers shuffle along a murky pre-fab corridor towards a smoke-enshrouded security checkpoint. A puffy- faced woman with a clipboard is walking down the lineup checking faces and ID cards. With her we discover Pikul and Geller, once again wearing their ID cards which identify them as LARRY ASHEN and BARB BRECKEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was cruel. I don't want to be here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wasn't cruel, it was desperate. C'mon, Pikul. You've just got a bad case of first-time user anxiety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like it here. I don't know what's going on. We're blundering around together in this unformed world, whose rules and objectives are largely unknown, seemingly indecipherable, or even Possibly non-existent, always on the verge of being killed by forces we don't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That sounds like my game, all right. They are now close enough to the security cubicle'at the end of the corridor to see the workers ahead of them being frisked by hand, then scanned by a wand similar to the one that Pikul used at the church.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That sounds like a game that's not going to be easy to market.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's a game that everybody's already playing! Existence, it's wonderful!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ASSEMBLY LINE - DAY Pikul and Geller have passed through security and now enter the assembly-line arena. They see Nourish at his accustomed place on the line, hunched over a pile of insect motherboards and now seeming, somehow, menacing, predatory in profile. The pair skirt the assembly-line area, carefully scanning as they go, but there is no wicker basket to be seen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ASSEMBLY BAYS - DAY Pikul and Geller walk down the aisle connecting the assembly bays. Other workers drift casually in and out, preparing for their day in a desultory fashion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cashier said it would be in a familiar place. Is there such a thing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My assembly bay. They make their way to the last assembly bay and slip inside it. There is, for the moment, nobody else there, but several pods have been left on the work tables half-assembled. Pikul spots it first, in the far corner: a large, mouldy wicker basket in the opposite corner. Something lumpy in it is covered by a thread-bare canvas sheet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that it over there? They stroll over to the basket. Geller kneels down and carefully begins to unwrap it while Pikul stands guard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd say it's exactly as advertised. The final wrap comes off. In the basket is a necrotic, purpled, very diseased-looking pod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, it's ugly. Even for a game- pod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a terrible urge to port into it. What about you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he thinks she's joking) Oh, sure. Yes. Desperate to port into it. Geller steps over to a bunch of UmbyCords draped over a peg and strips one off. She sits down on a rotting wooden folding chair next to the death-pod's basket and ports in one end of the UmbyCord.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here we go. Wanna give me a hand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not serious! I mean, that's a diseased pod! Once you port into that, you become, you... you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a quick smile) Exactly. Help me. Pikul kneels beside her as she pulls up her shirt to reveal her bioport. Geller hands him the free end of the UmbyCord and he ports it into her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long does it take for the infection to take hold?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No time at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then you quietly port into all the other pods and spread the infection to them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pale, shaky) Oh, God!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's happening?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something's wrong!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna unport you now. Pikul tries to unport Geller, but her bioport has swollen and seized the jack. He gives the UmbyCord a tug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in sudden pain)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, don't! That really hurts! Pikul lets go. The death-pod, triggered off by Pikul's attempt to disconnect Geller, now begins to convulse in peristaltic waves in its wicker basket. Pikul looks around desperately and spots a clutch of tools hanging from nails on the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to cut you free!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, don't, I'm afraid! But Pikul seizes a crude linoleum knife used for trimming oversized motherboards and, with three erratic slashes at the quivering UmbyCord, hacks her loose. Blood immediately pours out of both ends of the severed cord.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (wide-eyed, quietly) Pikul. I'm bleeding to death. .9 Panic-stricken, Pikul steps on Geller's end of the cord to stop the bleeding. It seems to work, but Geller moans horribly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry! I don't know what else to do!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what to do. Pikul twists awkwardly around to see Yevgeny Nourish standing just behind him. He is in the process of slipping a large propane torch off its wall hook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know exactly what to do. Nourish unscrews the gas valve and ignites the torch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Death to Realism! Nourish turns the blazing torch on the pod in the basket. Where the cone of flame hits the pod, it begins to shrivel, crackle, sputter fat. The pod itself tries to ripple away from the searing flame as though it were alive. Nourish laughs and begins to play the cone over the entire surface of the pod. Geller sinks to the ground in exhaustion, holds on to Pikul's leg. The death-pod now swells and bubbles under the torch's flame, then explodes with a dull whump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ASSEMBLY LINE - DAY A huge cloud, speckled black and gray, billows upwards and floats out over the intersecting walls of the stalls and into the main area of the Trout Farm's assembly line, where it begins to settle like granular. ash on the startled workers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ASSEMBLY BAYS - NIGHT i Horrified, Nourish watches the thick cloud of infectious spores floating out of his reach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no! S: Gathering up her last shreds of energy, Geller suddenly shoves a startled Pikul off her cord and picks up the linoleum knife from where Pikul dropped it. Trailing her bloody cord, she lunges at Nourishi driving the rusty, curved blade into his back with great force. Nourish turns to Geller, the torch circling towards her, wavering. He tries to touch her with the flame, staggers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Death... death to the demoness Barb Brecken... to the...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Death to who? (he fingers his ID card) Oh, yeah... Barb... Nourish drops the torch, falls to the ground and snaps into the foetal position. A wall of flame roars up around him, fueled by the straw, wood, canvas, pod-oils. Pikul jumps over to Geller and picks up the trailing cord, twists it in his hands until it stops bleeding. All four walls of the assembly bay are on fire now. The doorway is a flapping sheet of flame. Mixing with the swelling rush of the flame are the sounds of the entire plant going on alert: yells, screams, sirens, running feet, doors being slammed open and closed. Pikul holds Geller tightly. She is limp, weak, drained in his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we just lost the game. But now, strange, anomalous objects begin to appear out a nowhere in the flames - a chair, a tv set, a bath tub, a table, objects emerging into the game from the quest chalet. After a moment's confusion, Pikul smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or maybe not. And sure enough, the Trout Farm and its flames and its black cloud melt away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GUEST CHALET - NIGHT As the guest chalet melts up around them, Pikul finds himself back on the bed, as he expected; but he is still embracing the swooning Geller, which he had not expected.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Allegra, we're back home. What's the matter, what's wrong? As Geller swims back up into full consciousness, she begins to talk, mumbling at first, then with terrible clarity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pikul. It's here, it's happened. It's come back here with us. We brought it back with us from eXistenZ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brought what back? I can't understand what you're saying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We brought the disease back with us. My pod is diseased. As though realizing the implications of what she's saying for the first time, Geller twists away from Pikul and begins to fumble with her UmbyJack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God, I'm really going to lose it, I'm going to lose my game! Unport me! C'mon, unport me! Pikul unports her, then begins to tug at his own jack. When he takes a close look at the pod, he can see that it looks - unhealthy. Geller jumps off the bed and yanks open her bag on the table. She pulls out a tiny hypodermic syringe, unwraps it, flicks the bubbles out of it, falls to her knees beside the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm coming, I'm coming! Geller jabs the pod with the needle. As sne pushes in the plunger, she starts to massage it with her free hand, rub it, prod it. She's so close to it we think she might give it mouth-to-mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But this can't be possible. How can a game event emerge into real life?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a very weird reality- bleed-through effect happening here. I'm not sure I get it. Pikul finally gets his UmbyCord unplugged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's in that needle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's an anti-viral serum. It sometimes works if you get it in time. Unconsciously, Pikul scratches at his bioport. Geller fixes on him with strange intensity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lemme see your bioport.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lemme see it! Pikul turns and shows it to her. She begins to examine it with microscopic, clinical attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what happened. It's Vinokur, that bastard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vinokur?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gave you a new bioport, didn't he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gave you an infected bioport so that my pod would die and so would my game-system.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm infected? Wait a minute!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The poor thing was trying to tell us that it was sick by introducing the theme of disease into our game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The theme of disease? I'm fucking reall infected! Is it going to crawl up my spine and rot my brain?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (suddenly all business) All right, don't panic. I've got something that will help you. Brusquely wiping away her tears, Geller goes over to her bag and takes out a cork-shaped plastic capsule. She snaps open the capsule to reveal a knurled, plug-like electronic device.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to seal up your bioport with this anti-viral resonator. Geller bends over Pikul and works the device into his bioport until it's flush with his skin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (inserting the device) It uses the Umby pick-ups for power. Should cleanse all your porting channels of infection in a few hours. It'11 give you a little skin buzz when it's done. Of course, we can't play until then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (controlling his panic) Yeah, great. Now, listen. This could be critical. Were you really saying that Vinokur is an (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: agent of the Anti- eXistenZialists? Because if he is, if he's with them, then we are really...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, God! Pikul, my pod's dying. Sure enough, the thing is quivering, rippling, convulsing, turning purple.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't help it! I can't do anything for it! Geller falls to her knees beside the pod. As though triggered by this action, an explosion in the nearest chalet blows the windows and the door out of the guest chalet. Pikul and Geller are knocked to the floor by the impact of the blast. Waves of heat and debris billow into the room. A moment of eery silence, and then Pikul and Geller peek wide-eyed over the-edge of the bed. Flames now engulf the nearby chalet, all too clearly visible throught the shattered window frames. Sounds of pandemonium begin to well up from the hills below, and then a figure steps boldly in through the doorway. When the flamelight flickers over his face, Pikul and Geller are stunned to see that it is the cashier, and he is cradling a real-life submachine gun in his arms. The cashier screams at the bewildered and terrified pair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The uprising has begun! The whole place is on fire! Let's go! You've got to get out of here. They'll be looking for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cashier? He's a game character! How can he be here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know! I don't know! The cashier strides into the room and pulls her to her feet. She tries to pick up her pod, but the cashier tugs her away from it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave that rotting piece of meat here. It's done its job. Let it die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But my game! My game's inside it. I don't want my game to die. The cashier unslings his submachine gun, cocks it, and blows the pod into streaks of slime, flesh, and slivers of insect- board. Geller is in shock. Pikul turns her to face him, speaks' forcefully right into her face, shuts everything else out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Allegra, listen to me. I think we're still inside the game. I think your real pod's out there somewhere, somewhere safe. I think it's OK to let go of this one, this pod. It's not the real one. A Molotov cocktail comes sailing into the room and shatters against the bed. The bed ignites with an explosive whump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody out! now! The three of them scramble out into the fiery night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cashier leads Pikul and Geller out of the guest chalet and down the mountain path. The chalet next to theirs begins to implode as they scurry by it. As they flee, they realize that all the chalets are on fire. There are people trying to fight the fires, running r frantically everywhere with hand-held extinguishers. There is also scattered gunfire, but who's firing on whom is impossible to tell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HILLTOP - NIGHT The cashier now leads them up to the top of a hill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up here. We can see everything from here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it that we're seeing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The victory of Realism. And you were part of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The death of eXistenZ. And we were part of it. The cashier turns on her with his gun. He snaps out his old clip and slams home a new one. He cocks the gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's just one more thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing? We're on your side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could you be? How could Allegra Geller, the world's premiere game designer, be on our side? (off their bewildered
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Y93.' We know who you are. You can't hide inside a game forever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something's slipped over the edge, here, Allegra. Something's all wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There. You see what I mean. You see the problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cashier raises his gun to fire at Geller, but before he can pull the trigger, he jolts backwards and falls twitching to the ground. From the shadows of the trees, backlit by the fiery landscape below, steps Kiri Vinokur. In his hand he holds the gristle gun which Pikul assembled in the Chinese restaurant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tried to find you. Thank God I got here in time. (pause; waggles the gun) My dog brought me this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't get here in time. My game is dead. (FOCUSSING) You murdered my game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, just your pod. I replicated the entire contents of your pod when I fixed your nerve boards. They're in safe-keeping. They're all in one piece.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You copied eXistenZ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (soft, pleading) Allegra, come over to Cortical Systematics. Yes, yes, Cortical Systematics. I'm defecting and so are all the Antenna Research top brass, Pellatt, Melzack, Sherrin, everybody good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a spy for Cortical Systematics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute. Cortical Systematics is just the qame version, it's only...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a spy, exactly. I think of myself as a personnel exchange engineer. If you want to be reunited with your creation, you'll come over to us. eXistenZ, by Allegra Geller. Only from Cortical Systematics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only from Antenna Research.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But why stay with them? Look at that mess down there. How could you trust Antenna again, when they've endangered you like this? Geller seems to have lost the thread. She wanders over to the cashier's body and disentangles his submachine gun from him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (referring to cashier) You know, this guy was actually going to kill me. Vinokur looks to Pikul for support.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you talk to her? I mean, we can take you with us too. But before Pikul can respond, Geller, now sitting next to the cashier's body on the grass, opens fire at Vinokur with the submachine gun. Vinokur falls with a startled expression on his face. Pikul, absolutely horrified, runs at Geller and kicks the weapon out of her hand, picks it up himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck are you doing?! You've killed him! Are you gonna kill me next?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, Pikul. He's only a game character. And I didn't like the way he was messing with my mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't you? You didn't like that and so you killed him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was only a game character.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Allegra. What if we're not in the game anymore?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (confused, childlike) Huh? If... if we... we're not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we're not, then you just killed someone real. A real person. (PAUSE) You see what can happen. It's important for me that you see that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (standing over her) It wasn't an accident that you and I ended up on the run together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not an accident? Pikul hefts the submachine gun in his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's why you never had a bioport. You were one of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I still am one of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you have a bioport now. (IRONIC) I thought that was forbidden to Anti-eXistenZialists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I made the bioport sacrifice to get close to you, to make love to my enemy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would you do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To understand what I have to kill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then. understand this. Geller produces a tiny electronic remote controller from the pocket of her shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Understand that I suspected who you were from the moment you made that fake phone call to yourself in the limo. Understand that I knew you were my real assassin when you pointed the gun at me in the Chinese restaurant. She flicks up a safety cover on the remote's tip, revealing a toggle switch. Pikul's hands tense around the submachine gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And understand that you're dead. Geller flips the toggle switch. The base of Pikul's spine blows out, his shirt billowing with blood as his bioport explodes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A delighted Geller dances to her feet as Pikul staggers backwards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Death to the demon Ted Pikul! His eyes frozen in a death stare, Pikul falls, rolls down the hill into the underbrush. Smoke creeping up from the fires below curls over him like a blanket. Arms raised in the air, Geller dances around on the top of the hill, looking down on the flames and the chaos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (confident, laughing) Have I won the game? Have I won? Have I won? The hill, the trees, the flames melt down around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We melt back up into the church, which we last saw in the first scene. But there are many differences between then and now, Geller is sitting in her chair on the dais as before, her eyes just beginning to flutter open. But Pikul is sitting next to her, also playing the game. And next to him is Nourish, whom we are even more surprised to see in this context. Aad in fact, the players who are sitting in the circle of chairs on the dais are all characters who have been in the movie up to this point: Nader, the cashier, Dichter, Gas, Vinkokur, even Frances, the limo driver. The players are all emerging from a game that has just ended - the movie we have been watching - and they begin to stir in their game gear, which is nothing like the organic pod- technology we have just seen. On the contrary, the garners are wearing head-gear with electrodes, more like normal clunky Virtual-Reality equipment, and are linked by mundane wires. In their laps they hold, not game-pods, but sleek plastic game modules, each about the size of a walkman, with holes into Which I their left thumbs are inserted - a simpler and cruder version of the bioports we have become used to. Watching the proceedings from down on the church floor are two security guards, neither of whom is Pikul, of course. On a leash, one of the security guards holds the dog that, in the game, picked up the gristle gun in the Chinese restaurant. Also monitoring the action are a woman, Merle, who is the game's actual project manager - the real-life version of the game-character Levi - and her two assistants. There is a collective sigh as the game finally releases the players, and now they are free to remove their thumbs from the game modules and slide their head-gear off. The two assistants - the real-life ones are both matronly women - begin to help everyone unplug, neatly gathering up the equipment in padded bags as they go. A broadly smiling Merle mounts the dais and stands in the centre of the ring of players.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all back? The man whom we knew in the game as Yevgeny Nourish immediately stands and takes charge. But it is a different Nourish, exuberant, sensitive and artistic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're back, Merle. Although I have a feeling some of our crew might not realize it yet. Shaky laughter from some of the players. Throughout the following round of comments from the garners, whom we now realize have been, up to now, playing characters in a game, we hear nothing from Pikul and Geller. These two, who sit next to each other and are now holding hands, remain enigmatically silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. Anybody here want a bowl of hot and sour soup? (LAUGHTER)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will, if you make sure there R are some insect boards in the F( rice. (LAUGHTER)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long were we gone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About twenty minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It seemed like days. That's fantastic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. If you stayed in the gameworld for most of your life, you could live to be five hundred years old! (LAUGHTER)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The twists and turns at the end made my head spin. Maybe there were too many, to fast to absorb. (to Pikul and Geller) Hey, but you two were fantastic. You guys are game divas! I think you both deserved to win. There is general agreement amongst the garners about this compliment to Pikul and Geller. The pair just smile sweetly and bob their heads modestly at the smattering of applause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a little jealous) Well me, I was really bummed out at first. I got knocked out of the game so soon. It was fun to watch the rest, though. I liked that part where the ones who got knocked out of the game early got to be spooky customers in the game store.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you were so wonderfully bad. So scary and crazy. I had a lot to do in that first scene in the church but I thought my character was kind of boring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you know, I'm a gas-jockey in real life, so I was kind of disappointed that I was basically the same thing in the game. A little more fantasy, there, fellers. Y{
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Interesting. Interesting. Hold that thought for the focus group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (indicating game module) Can I keep this? I've never felt anything like it! And I love this little thumb-hole. It's fantastic! (appreciative laughs and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice try, but you're going to have to turn them in because they're beta versions, pre- production hand-made specials, and we need to study them after use for wear and tear and other things. But you'll get a certificate for helping us out here - I'm right about that, aren't I, Merle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that will entitle you to reserve one of the first batch of the TranscendenZ by PilgrImage game modules to hit the market, and at a seriously discounted price. You're gonna love it. Amidst applause and general excitement, Merle turns to the tripod-mounted chalkboard standing, as in the first scene, at the back of the dais. There we see the words that she has already written: TranscendenZ by PilgrImage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember - it's written like this. Capital T, capital Z. TranscendenZ. It's new, it's from Pilgrimage - capital P. capital
direction.name: direction
